programme.title: Sideways
Bezdroża
Sideways
programme.desc:
Sideways: Directed by Alexander Payne. With Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church, Virginia Madsen, Sandra Oh. Two men reaching middle age with not much to show but disappointment embark on a week-long road trip through California's wine country, just as one is about to take a trip down the aisle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0375063/","name":"Sideways","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0Mjg3MzkxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNDU1OTY3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two men reaching middle age with not much to show but disappointment embark on a week-long road trip through California's wine country, just as one is about to take a trip down the aisle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0375063/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"george.schmidt"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A truly vintage comedy.","reviewBody":"SIDEWAYS (2004) **** Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church, Virginia Madsen, Sandra Oh. (DIR: Alexander Payne)

A truly vintage comedy. Paul Giamatti is one of our finest character actors who seems to be neck-and-neck with William H. Macy on cornering the market of portraying losers as a cottage industry and in the latest endeavor of hapless misanthropes he may have found Oscar gold.

Giamatti stars as Miles Raymond, a miserable mope of a man who realizes he is never going to amount to anything especially given the fact that he is his own worst enemy in his highly critical outlook on life particularly on two things he holds dear: his struggling attempts to become a writer of notice and his taste in wine. The latter leads him to a certain road trip to salvation when he embarks upon a few days of r&r away from his stagnant day job as a middle school English teacher with his best friend and former college roomie Jack (Church in easily the career defining role of his life since his hey day on the TV sitcom 'Wings') whose impending nuptials is Miles' wedding gift as the best man. Jack, a long-in-the tooth second-rate soap actor whose 15 minutes are at a close 14:59 is adamant about getting laid for one last time before his commitment to a younger woman who clearly deserves better (and Jack shrewdly knows this).

As the duo drive through the sun-dappled wine country of Northern California in a road trip not unlike two virginal, horny teens looking to pop their respective cherries, they come across two unlikely conquests. One is the shapely and surprisingly-down-to-earth waitress Maya (Madsen in a career comeback of epic proportions shines through the Giamatti gloom) who strikes a fancy to the depressed Miles while Jack has his sights on the sexy wine pourer Stephanie (the sublimely, reassuringly funny Oh, and real  life wife to director Payne) who also is charmed by the blithely feckless Jack. What unfolds is a sweet yet too-good-to-be true few days of bliss and unbridled emotional rescue for the foursome as they take to one another like ducks to water although Miles' hesitancy is deeply reasoned since he is still licking the open wounds of his two-year old divorce.

Payne, one of my favorite filmmakers, doesn't disappoint as he dollops evenly the tragic-comic proceedings with his frequent long-time collaborator Jim Taylor in adapting an unpublished novel by Rex Pickett that has many layers to it and doesn't betray its four intriguing and ultimately human characters with all their flaws and neuroses on full display. Each actor shines with a few moments of soliloquies and dialogue that ring true that will have you laughing til you cry and vice versa (and that my friend is no easy trick)!

The four actors give supremely wonderfully acted turns and all are Oscar worthy as well as the screenplay which mixes misery with hope and some truly funny moments including an anger management golf sequence that feels like an outtake from 'Caddyshack' and Giamatti's drunken phone call to his ex is on par with Jon Favreau's car-accident-in-slow-motion answering machine mishap in 'Swingers'  one for the archives. Church makes his borderline jerk a quasi-pathetic lothario who finally sees the forest for the trees in a surprisingly moving moment of realization in a teary confessional; Oh unleashes the old chestnut of a woman's scorn with no-holds-barred and Madsen is a true welcome back from a seemingly endless string of nothing vehicles into this warm and welcome turn as comforting as a blanket on a wintry night in front of a cozy fire.

While it is so easy to resort to the wine as metaphor  as the film amply does with smart, sharp and pungent dialogue  the film is a full-bodied, never precocious vintage that needs to be savored in a desirable bouquet of cinematic finesse."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":186143,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-10-22","keywords":"wine,road trip,vineyard,middle age,wine tasting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sideways","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi864551193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI2OGZmZWMtMjY5Yi00Zjk5LWEwMGYtM2NiOTY0MDdiYmRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI2OGZmZWMtMjY5Yi00Zjk5LWEwMGYtM2NiOTY0MDdiYmRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316079/","name":"Paul Giamatti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002006/","name":"Thomas Haden Church"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000515/","name":"Virginia Madsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0088247/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133320/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0681914/","name":"Rex Pickett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

Gainey (role=Cammi's Husband), Alysia Reiner (role=Christine Erganian), Shake Tukhmanyan (role=Mrs. Erganian), Shaun Duke (role=Mike Erganian), Robert Covarrubias (role=Miles's Building Manager)

programme.title: Creation Stories
Creation Stories
programme.desc:
Creation Stories: Directed by Nick Moran. With Ewen Bremner, Leo Flanagan, Richard Jobson, Rori Hawthorn. Creation Stories tells the unforgettable tale of infamous Creation Records label head Alan McGee; and of how one written-off young Glaswegian upstart rose to irrevocably change the face of British culture." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5693182/","name":"Creation Stories","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmZmZTM5ZjItMDYyZC00M2JlLThlMGEtOWM2ODE4ZDczMmU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc2OTY0MDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Creation Stories tells the unforgettable tale of infamous Creation Records label head Alan McGee; and of how one written-off young Glaswegian upstart rose to irrevocably change the face of British culture.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5693182/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alternapop"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Few redeeming qualities","reviewBody":"That was bloody awful, and I'm a huge fan of Creation Records.

There were a few funny lines but overall it felt like a Saturday Night Live movie that was derived from a moderately funny skit that shouldn't have been made.

It was meandering and was incredibly hard to understand what was being said half the time.

Inicjały SG
Iniciales S.G.
programme.desc: Initials SG: Directed by Rania Attieh, Daniel Garcia. With Diego Peretti, Julianne Nicholson, Daniel Fanego, Francisco Lumerman. An aging, Argentine, Serge Gainsbourg wannabe struggles to deal with a career he can't seem to get on track, an affair he doesn't want and a crime he didn't mean to commit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9080672/","name":"Initials SG","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDcyNWFjNjktNzFkZC00NzI4LThkYTMtNjY5ZWZlYzI4ZTkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk1NzAxNg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging, Argentine, Serge Gainsbourg wannabe struggles to deal with a career he can't seem to get on track, an affair he doesn't want and a crime he didn't mean to commit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9080672/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"trvary"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amazing","reviewBody":"I viewed this at Tribeca (at its premiere actually) and I want to let everyone know that's this movie is a freaking masterpiece. I love it's style. It's a super intriguing character study that's is both emotional and hilarious and the lead performance by Diego Perretti is extremely nuanced and deserving of being placed up with some of the greats. I'm worried this won't get the attention it deserves so if you see this, find this movie, watch this movie, and please support it because I really wanna we what these directors have on store next. Also they seem like super nice people they were at the premiere.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":298,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2019-09-19","keywords":"reference to serge gainsbourg,male protagonist,violence,sauna,year 2014","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0673391/","name":"Diego Peretti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0629855/","name":"Julianne Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266723/","name":"Daniel Fanego"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4275547/","name":"Rania Attieh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2525426/","name":"Daniel Garcia"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0481533/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0419254/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0732895/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4275547/","name":"Rania Attieh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2525426/","name":"Daniel Garcia"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Watch List
Lista
Watch List
programme.desc: Watch List: Directed by Ben Rekhi. With Arthur Acuña, Bernard Carritero, Alessandra de Rossi, Jake Macapagal. After her husband is mysteriously killed in the drug wars of the Philippines, a widowed mother of three must confront her own darkness to protect her children from further harm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8512120/","name":"Watch List","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjRhMzUyNzEtOGUzNC00MDFmLThjMmItNmJiNWIyZmU4MWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE2MjUwNTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"After her husband is mysteriously killed in the drug wars of the Philippines, a widowed mother of three must confront her own darkness to protect her children from further harm.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8512120/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alain-kapel5"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Solid thriller","reviewBody":"Watch List is a solid crime thriller from the Philippines. It's lean and mean, a bit melodramatic in a few scenes, but also tough to stomach for its cruel depiction of corruption and murderous police units. Viewers follow a woman who loses her husband after he gets shot by unknown assailants. This prompts her to try and look for his murderers, and her search leads her to a police inspector who promises they will be found if she agrees to work for him as an informant. However, she soon realizes this also includes being part of a hit squad... the plot moves forward with no stop gaps after this point. It's a straightforward film that dabbles in complicated real life issues revolving around the Philippines' uncompromising police operations. Drug users and dealers are taken out with little thought given to their current affairs. If they're on the ominous drug watch list, it's uncertain how long they have left before a hit squad comes for them. Acting is convincing and cinematography vivid and gritty, especially in nighttime scenes, further amplifying the film's tense and morally grey narrative. Some of the more apparent flaws here include a feeling of predictability, as many events are easy to foresee, while the film also tends to state the obvious in some of the dialogues. This doesn't detract from the overall impression, though, that Watch List is a pretty good film that should appeal to most crime thriller fans.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":241,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-02-19","keywords":"children","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch List","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4117675545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU2Nzg4MGUtOTIyZi00NTEyLWI3NDYtMTA3NTEwOTU3NTM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU2Nzg4MGUtOTIyZi00NTEyLWI3NDYtMTA3NTEwOTU3NTM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010355/","name":"Arthur Acuña"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6041424/","name":"Bernard Carritero"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211278/","name":"Alessandra de Rossi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1266863/","name":"Ben Rekhi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0146372/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0799784/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1266863/","name":"Ben Rekhi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2891978/","name":"Rona Lean Sales"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fellwechselzeit
Pora wylinki
Fellwechselzeit
programme.desc: Fellwechselzeit: Directed by Sabrina Mertens. With Zelda Espenschied, Miriam Schiweck, Freya Kreutzkam, Bernd Wolf. The still life of a family in 57 pictures. Germany in the 1970ies. Stephanie is an intelligent and lively child. But she leads an isolated life with her parents, marked by the symbiotic bonding with her mentally unstable mother. A mother who has never really left her own childhood behind and who lives amidst things of the past and the memories connected to them. Stephanie's relationship with her father is one of mistrust. The passing years only bring aging, but no future. Unspoken thoughts lurk underneath the surface of everyday life. So Stephanie retreats into a dark world of barbaric fantasies, that are nourished by the traces of the past and only belong to her alone. One day, however, Stephanie's secret invades the family's reality." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11758900/","name":"Fellwechselzeit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGFkZGQ2ODctZjViOS00Yjc0LThjZjctZjg1YzliNTRlMDVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODU2NjIzMjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The still life of a family in 57 pictures. Le rire
programme.desc: Le rire: Directed by Martin Laroche. With Christine Beaulieu, Micheline Lanctôt, Alexandre Landry, Catherine Proulx-Lemay. Mixing realism and worrying strangeness, Le Rire presents a humane exploration of the survivor's syndrome, the grieving process, the distance of time, the power of love, and the joy of being alive." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5649086/","name":"Le rire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzQ4OWM2MTItYjAzNS00N2IyLTgzYzYtYmNhNzRiZDcwMmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMxMzQ3ODA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mixing realism and worrying strangeness, Le Rire presents a humane exploration of the survivor's syndrome, the grieving process, the distance of time, the power of love, and the joy of being alive.","aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":122,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-01-31","keywords":"power,male nudity,male rear nudity,female nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"bande-annonce","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi108052249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI4ODMyZDgtY2Y2YS00NjI5LWE1ODUtNmM3ZjIwNDgxMjc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI4ODMyZDgtY2Y2YS00NjI5LWE1ODUtNmM3ZjIwNDgxMjc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bande-annonce du film Le Rire"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2336836/","name":"Christine Beaulieu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0484307/","name":"Micheline Lanctôt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5861077/","name":"Alexandre Landry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3602477/","name":"Martin Laroche"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0381052/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3602477/","name":"Martin Laroche"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kingpin
Kręglogłowi
Kingpin
programme.desc:
Kingpin: Directed by Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly. With Woody Harrelson, Randy Quaid, Vanessa Angel, Bill Murray. A star bowler whose career was prematurely "cut off" hopes to ride a new prodigy to success and riches." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116778/","name":"Kingpin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODAzODIyMDYwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTUyNTEzNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A star bowler whose career was prematurely "cut off" hopes to ride a new prodigy to success and riches.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116778/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alexkolokotronis"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"I Almost Died Of Laughter","reviewBody":"This of course is not a great movie but I just have to give it a 10/10. I have never laughed more in my life. Even the jokes that aren't funny are funny. This film's comedic build up is about the best you will ever see. It doesn't even matter what the punch line is, its how they get to it thats hilarious.

Now this cast was perfect. Anytime you have Randy Quaid in a film you just know the film is going to make you life just by looking at him. Kingpin couldn't have shown this any better as he plays an Amish man who just happens to be amazingly talented at bowling. Woody Harrelson plays a has-been ex-professional bowler who makes a comeback with managing through Randy Quaid. Together they go on a ride across the country making money left and right. Along the journey they are great supporting comedic performances given by Bill Murray and Vanessa Angel who certainly makes the look of the film more appealing.

The Farrelly brothers in my opinion give their best direction they've yet to have. Yet it is the writers who so perfectly set up one joke after another. It seems as if the script is so sharp that their are jokes within jokes. The Farrelly brother handle this material so well by virtual unknowns.

As I have said before this is not a great film but I would highly recommend this if your in the mood of watching something spontaneous. It may not be the most technically sound movie ever made or the deepest but I have never laughed so much in life and that in it self is what comedies are about.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":81216,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Sport"],"datePublished":"1996-07-26","keywords":"bowling,amish,on the road,big breasts,breasts","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi973258265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjIwYWEzNGItNDJjNy00MDIwLWEyODEtMmVkNGY1ZDE0YTYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjIwYWEzNGItNDJjNy00MDIwLWEyODEtMmVkNGY1ZDE0YTYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A star bowler whose career was prematurely "cut off" hopes to ride a new prodigy to success and riches."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000437/","name":"Woody Harrelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001642/","name":"Randy Quaid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000195/","name":"Bill Murray"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030480/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071430/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0622240/","name":"Mort Nathan"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sideways
Bezdroża
Sideways
programme.desc:
Sideways: Directed by Alexander Payne. With Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church, Virginia Madsen, Sandra Oh. Two men reaching middle age with not much to show but disappointment embark on a week-long road trip through California's wine country, just as one is about to take a trip down the aisle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0375063/","name":"Sideways","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0Mjg3MzkxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNDU1OTY3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two men reaching middle age with not much to show but disappointment embark on a week-long road trip through California's wine country, just as one is about to take a trip down the aisle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0375063/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"george.schmidt"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A truly vintage comedy.","reviewBody":"SIDEWAYS (2004) **** Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church, Virginia Madsen, Sandra Oh. (DIR: Alexander Payne)

A truly vintage comedy. Paul Giamatti is one of our finest character actors who seems to be neck-and-neck with William H. Macy on cornering the market of portraying losers as a cottage industry and in the latest endeavor of hapless misanthropes he may have found Oscar gold.

Giamatti stars as Miles Raymond, a miserable mope of a man who realizes he is never going to amount to anything especially given the fact that he is his own worst enemy in his highly critical outlook on life particularly on two things he holds dear: his struggling attempts to become a writer of notice and his taste in wine. The latter leads him to a certain road trip to salvation when he embarks upon a few days of r&r away from his stagnant day job as a middle school English teacher with his best friend and former college roomie Jack (Church in easily the career defining role of his life since his hey day on the TV sitcom 'Wings') whose impending nuptials is Miles' wedding gift as the best man. Jack, a long-in-the tooth second-rate soap actor whose 15 minutes are at a close 14:59 is adamant about getting laid for one last time before his commitment to a younger woman who clearly deserves better (and Jack shrewdly knows this).

As the duo drive through the sun-dappled wine country of Northern California in a road trip not unlike two virginal, horny teens looking to pop their respective cherries, they come across two unlikely conquests. One is the shapely and surprisingly-down-to-earth waitress Maya (Madsen in a career comeback of epic proportions shines through the Giamatti gloom) who strikes a fancy to the depressed Miles while Jack has his sights on the sexy wine pourer Stephanie (the sublimely, reassuringly funny Oh, and real  life wife to director Payne) who also is charmed by the blithely feckless Jack. What unfolds is a sweet yet too-good-to-be true few days of bliss and unbridled emotional rescue for the foursome as they take to one another like ducks to water although Miles' hesitancy is deeply reasoned since he is still licking the open wounds of his two-year old divorce.

Payne, one of my favorite filmmakers, doesn't disappoint as he dollops evenly the tragic-comic proceedings with his frequent long-time collaborator Jim Taylor in adapting an unpublished novel by Rex Pickett that has many layers to it and doesn't betray its four intriguing and ultimately human characters with all their flaws and neuroses on full display. Each actor shines with a few moments of soliloquies and dialogue that ring true that will have you laughing til you cry and vice versa (and that my friend is no easy trick)!

The four actors give supremely wonderfully acted turns and all are Oscar worthy as well as the screenplay which mixes misery with hope and some truly funny moments including an anger management golf sequence that feels like an outtake from 'Caddyshack' and Giamatti's drunken phone call to his ex is on par with Jon Favreau's car-accident-in-slow-motion answering machine mishap in 'Swingers'  one for the archives. Church makes his borderline jerk a quasi-pathetic lothario who finally sees the forest for the trees in a surprisingly moving moment of realization in a teary confessional; Oh unleashes the old chestnut of a woman's scorn with no-holds-barred and Madsen is a true welcome back from a seemingly endless string of nothing vehicles into this warm and welcome turn as comforting as a blanket on a wintry night in front of a cozy fire.

While it is so easy to resort to the wine as metaphor  as the film amply does with smart, sharp and pungent dialogue  the film is a full-bodied, never precocious vintage that needs to be savored in a desirable bouquet of cinematic finesse."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":186143,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-10-22","keywords":"wine,road trip,vineyard,middle age,wine tasting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sideways","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi864551193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI2OGZmZWMtMjY5Yi00Zjk5LWEwMGYtM2NiOTY0MDdiYmRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI2OGZmZWMtMjY5Yi00Zjk5LWEwMGYtM2NiOTY0MDdiYmRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316079/","name":"Paul Giamatti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002006/","name":"Thomas Haden Church"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000515/","name":"Virginia Madsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0088247/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133320/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0681914/","name":"Rex Pickett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

Gainey (role=Cammi's Husband), Alysia Reiner (role=Christine Erganian), Shake Tukhmanyan (role=Mrs. Erganian), Shaun Duke (role=Mike Erganian), Robert Covarrubias (role=Miles's Building Manager)

The four actors give supremely wonderfully acted turns and all are Oscar worthy as well as the screenplay which mixes misery with hope and some truly funny moments including an anger management golf sequence that feels like an outtake from 'Caddyshack' and Giamatti's drunken phone call to his ex is on par with Jon Favreau's car-accident-in-slow-motion answering machine mishap in 'Swingers'  one for the archives. Church makes his borderline jerk a quasi-pathetic lothario who finally sees the forest for the trees in a surprisingly moving moment of realization in a teary confessional; Oh unleashes the old chestnut of a woman's scorn with no-holds-barred and Madsen is a true welcome back from a seemingly endless string of nothing vehicles into this warm and welcome turn as comforting as a blanket on a wintry night in front of a cozy fire.

While it is so easy to resort to the wine as metaphor  as the film amply does with smart, sharp and pungent dialogue  the film is a full-bodied, never precocious vintage that needs to be savored in a desirable bouquet of cinematic finesse.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":186143,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-10-22","keywords":"wine,road trip,vineyard,middle age,wine tasting","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sideways","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi864551193","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI2OGZmZWMtMjY5Yi00Zjk5LWEwMGYtM2NiOTY0MDdiYmRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI2OGZmZWMtMjY5Yi00Zjk5LWEwMGYtM2NiOTY0MDdiYmRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316079/","name":"Paul Giamatti","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002006/","name":"Thomas Haden Church","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000515/","name":"Virginia Madsen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0088247/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133320/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0681914/","name":"Rex Pickett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"],"duration":"PT2H7M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Alexander Payne

programme.title: Werk ohne Autor
Obrazy bez autora
Werk ohne Autor
programme.desc:
Werk ohne Autor: Directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. With Tom Schilling, Sebastian Koch, Paula Beer, Saskia Rosendahl. German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5311542/","name":"Werk ohne Autor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUwYTQxZDYtYTZlMy00YmVhLTkyOTYtOTUwMzI2NTBlOWNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM2NTg3Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5311542/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FrenchEddieFelson"},"dateCreated":"2019-07-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nazism, communism, capitalism ... and art!","reviewBody":"This captivating and moving movie is essentially based on encounters, fortuitous or not, of good omen or not, in Germany, GDR and then FRG.

Professor Carl Seeband (Sebastian Koch) is a brilliant gynecologist, cold and completely devoid of empathy. His 'talent' will enable him to become an imminent member of the Nazi Party and to actively work in the eugenics process in order to improve the 'racial hygiene'. Kurt Barnert (Tom Schilling) is a young artist whose inspiration seems to be animated by repressed memories of his aunt Elisabeth May (Saskia Rosendahl), who mysteriously lost her mind during the rise of Nazism in the 30s, then silently 'disappeared' just before the Second World War: Elizabeth's fate will end at a fatal meeting with Professor Carl Seeband. A few years later, Kurt Barnert will accidentally fall in love with Ellie Seeband (Paula Beer), the only daughter of Professor Carl Seeband.

Freely inspired by the life of Gerhard Richter, the film describes the three decades of a black and then red Germany, struck by two destructive ideologies, before being sold to capitalism. Without reaching the near-perfectness of Das Leben der Anderen (2006), this film is excellent: casting of first choice, neat photography, dialogues skillfully written, captivating scenario, a clever mix of sensual and sweet scenes alternately with cold and depressing other ones, ... As a synthesis: 8 of 10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19342,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-10-03","keywords":"east germany,painter,doctor,forced abortion,pregnancy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1224587801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Never Look Away' follows thirty years in the life of artist Kurt Barnert (a character loosely based on Gerhard Richter). From a childhood witnessing Nazi Germany to life in post-war East Berlin."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462407/","name":"Sebastian Koch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3559009/","name":"Paula Beer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0569143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0128215/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"duration":"PT3H9M"}</script><metacontent="

German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5311542/","name":"Werk ohne Autor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUwYTQxZDYtYTZlMy00YmVhLTkyOTYtOTUwMzI2NTBlOWNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM2NTg3Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5311542/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"FrenchEddieFelson","dateCreated":"2019-07-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nazism, communism, capitalism ... and art!","reviewBody":"This captivating and moving movie is essentially based on encounters, fortuitous or not, of good omen or not, in Germany, GDR and then FRG.

Professor Carl Seeband (Sebastian Koch) is a brilliant gynecologist, cold and completely devoid of empathy. His 'talent' will enable him to become an imminent member of the Nazi Party and to actively work in the eugenics process in order to improve the 'racial hygiene'. Kurt Barnert (Tom Schilling) is a young artist whose inspiration seems to be animated by repressed memories of his aunt Elisabeth May (Saskia Rosendahl), who mysteriously lost her mind during the rise of Nazism in the 30s, then silently 'disappeared' just before the Second World War: Elizabeth's fate will end at a fatal meeting with Professor Carl Seeband. A few years later, Kurt Barnert will accidentally fall in love with Ellie Seeband (Paula Beer), the only daughter of Professor Carl Seeband.

Freely inspired by the life of Gerhard Richter, the film describes the three decades of a black and then red Germany, struck by two destructive ideologies, before being sold to capitalism. Without reaching the near-perfectness of Das Leben der Anderen (2006), this film is excellent: casting of first choice, neat photography, dialogues skillfully written, captivating scenario, a clever mix of sensual and sweet scenes alternately with cold and depressing other ones, ... As a synthesis: 8 of 10","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19342,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-10-03","keywords":"east germany,painter,doctor,forced abortion,pregnancy","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1224587801","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Never Look Away' follows thirty years in the life of artist Kurt Barnert (a character loosely based on Gerhard Richter). Adrenalina
Crank
programme.desc: Crank: Directed by Mark Neveldine, Brian Taylor. With Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Jose Pablo Cantillo, Efren Ramirez. Professional assassin Chev Chelios learns his rival has injected him with a poison that will kill him if his heart rate drops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479884/","name":"Crank","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg0NjAxNDY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA5MjMzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Professional assassin Chev Chelios learns his rival has injected him with a poison that will kill him if his heart rate drops.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479884/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LagerLagerLagerShouting"},"dateCreated":"2008-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Leave Your Brain At The Door.","reviewBody":"If you like brainless action flicks with insane set-pieces, great one-liners and zero character development so you don't give a rat's-ass about them, then Crank is probably the film for you. It is done originally, like a computer game where the action supersedes the plot. It keeps the film moving and the viewer entertained at the same time at the ridiculous and extreme scenarios and this is all the directors want Crank to do. Everything, including generic realism, convincing plot and background characters plays second-fiddle to the stylised action and I couldn't help but be entertained, especially at the completely unsubtle contemporary culture-clash comedy references!\n\n6/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":242822,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2007-01-31","keywords":"outdoor sex,heart,poison,public nudity,cult film","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Crank","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3364028953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2FlZTk5N2EtMTY5ZC00NTE5LWIwNmUtOTdhMWVjYTVhNGZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2FlZTk5N2EtMTY5ZC00NTE5LWIwNmUtOTdhMWVjYTVhNGZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man with an hour to live exacts revenge on his murderers in this trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005458/","name":"Jason Statham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005442/","name":"Amy Smart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0764430/","name":"Carlos Sanz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004410/","name":"Mark Neveldine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0962729/","name":"Brian Taylor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005323/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060306/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029540/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004410/","name":"Mark Neveldine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0962729/","name":"Brian Taylor"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: 9-1-1: Created by Brad Falchuk, Tim Minear, Ryan Murphy. With Angela Bassett, Peter Krause, Oliver Stark, Aisha Hinds. programme.title: Wish I Was Here
Gdybym tylko tu był
Wish I Was Here
programme.desc:
Wish I Was Here: Directed by Zach Braff. With Zach Braff, Pierce Gagnon, Kate Hudson, Joey King. A struggling actor, father and husband finds himself at a major crossroads, which forces him to examine his life, his family and his career." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2870708/","name":"Wish I Was Here","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MTM5NTY2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE4OTk4MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A struggling actor, father and husband finds himself at a major crossroads, which forces him to examine his life, his family and his career.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2870708/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alexrwatson-888-169026"},"dateCreated":"2014-08-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wish I Was Here Review","reviewBody":"Admittedly, this is the first Zach Braff film I have seen. I only saw one trailer for the film, and it immediately intrigued me. I did not hate this film, but I also did not love and found myself in a lukewarm middle ground. For everything I liked, there was something I did not like.

First off, the story. The story as a whole deals with living life and dealing with death which was pulled off fairly well. However, there were several things in the script that I feel like took away from the film and the story Braff was telling. One of the those things were the laughs or lack thereof. 

The script thinks its wittier and funnier than it actually is with most jokes missing that hitting. The movie also thinks it's deeper than it actually is. Maybe that's just Braff's style, but to me it seemed like it was more style over substance.

I did really enjoy the soundtrack for the film and Braff gave a good performance as a 30-something-year-old treading the water in his life.

I will definitely give Braff's future movies another shot and will see Garden State soon, but Wish I was Here was just not as good as I hoped it would be.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":37685,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-07-25","keywords":"dream sequence,crowdfunded,sex scene,furry,office worker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1612557593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxMzU2ODg0OTleQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDA3NjkzODEx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxMzU2ODg0OTleQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDA3NjkzODEx._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Aidan Bloom, a struggling actor, father, and husband, who at 35 is still trying to find a purpose for his life. He winds up trying to homeschool his two children when his father can no longer afford to pay for private education and the only available public school is on its last legs. Through teaching them about life his way, Aidan gradually discovers some of the parts of himself he couldn't find. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0103785/","name":"Zach Braff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1428821/","name":"Joey King"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3163952/","name":"Pierce Gagnon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0103785/","name":"Zach Braff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001099/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118437/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0103783/","name":"Adam J. programme.title: Minority Report
Raport mniejszości
Minority Report
programme.desc:
Minority Report: Directed by Steven Spielberg. With Tom Cruise, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough. In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0181689/","name":"Minority Report","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI3YzZjZjEtMDdjOC00OWVjLTk0YmYtYzI2MGMwZjFiMzBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0181689/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"argv"},"dateCreated":"2002-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Action/thriller with Signature Highlights from Spielberg to Cruise","reviewBody":"Minority Report is the latest film from Stephen Spielberg that stars Tom Cruise as a cop from the year 2054, who works in the pre-crime division of the Washington D.C police department. The division's ability to stop murders before they happen is based on the psychic ability of three people who were mutant byproducts of a failed genetic program designed to help babies born from drug-dependent mothers. Cruise's character, John Anderton, is motivated by the loss of his own son, who was abducted and murdered six years earlier. Accordingly, he's a strong supporter of the controversial program, whose opponents feel it could potentially make an error and people might be wrongfully convicted, if not potentially rehabilitated. That action begins when Anderton is identified as a future killer, and he hits the road running. This may sound a little like The Fugitive, but in this case, you don't know if the man on the run is--or, rather, will be--guilty.

Based on a short story by futurist Phillip K. Dick, author of Blade Runner, the atmosphere of a dark world with high technology having gotten out of hand, almost as though it snuck up on us without our knowing, remains the theme. To remind us that we aren't controlled by technology, but are nonetheless overrun by it, there are frequent references to current-day familiarities, such as department stores and restaurants, such as The Gap and McDonalds, where impressively entertaining high-tech mass marketing gadgets know what you've purchased before and offer new suggestions for consideration. (Sounds like a visit to amazon.com?) Spielberg lightens up the tone with his signature wit and humorous quips and visuals now and then, as opposed to Ridley Scott's more serious and consistently dark visualization portrayed in Blade Runner.

As a plotline, Minority Report is intelligent, has a good consistent flow, isn't always predictable (at least not that long before it happens), has many twists and turns with legitimate dead-ends, and above all, tells a plausible story (even if the basic premise itself requires considerable suspension of disbelief). As Anderton begins to unravel the true story about the corruption behind the pre-crime program, he is lead even further towards his destination as predicted by the `pre-cognitives' who predicted his crime. To tell any more of the story would disclose too much; besides, it isn't necessary. You know all you need to know here.

The best parts of the movie are so good  from the high-tech special effects to the light-hearted humorous moments to the good, steady flow of the action and plotline  that the problems with the film are easily forgiven. That said, my main gripe is the presumption that, in the future, anyone convicted of a crime before it happens is immediately sent to a state of suspended animation, an alternative form of the death penalty. This is obviously one of the main sources of controversy within the storyline, but anyone can see that, in almost all cases, the predicted murders were not premeditated, if not potentially accidental, in which case, psychological counseling and some form of probation would be enough. There's nothing to suggest in the film that the context is a police state, which would allow the premise to make sense. Yet, so much of the movie is based on this premise, that may be bothersome to the discerning viewer. There are many such similar oversimplifications, each of which could be quite easily solved with a minor change or a quick dialog line or two, hence a mild sense of sloppiness in direction.

Still, in the end, these didn't bother me that much. I still had a great time, and enjoyed it as the frivolous and wonderfully playful action/thriller it was intended to be."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":529331,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2002-09-18","keywords":"year 2054,future noir,neo noir,washington d.c.,psychic","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Minority Report","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3333161241","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFhMjlhYTItMzViYi00ODFiLTlhNTAtYzQyYzM5ZmM4MDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFhMjlhYTItMzViYi00ODFiLTlhNTAtYzQyYzM5ZmM4MDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268199/","name":"Colin Farrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0608090/","name":"Samantha Morton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000229/","name":"Steven Spielberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001140/","name":"Philip K. Dick"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0291082/","name":"Scott Frank"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0169509/","name":"Jon Cohen"}],"duration":"PT2H25M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0181689, Title: Minority Report, --- Description: Minority Report: Directed by Steven Spielberg. With Tom Cruise, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough. In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0181689/","name":"Minority Report","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI3YzZjZjEtMDdjOC00OWVjLTk0YmYtYzI2MGMwZjFiMzBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0181689/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"argv","dateCreated":"2002-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Action/thriller with Signature Highlights from Spielberg to Cruise","reviewBody":"Minority Report is the latest film from Stephen Spielberg that stars Tom Cruise as a cop from the year 2054, who works in the pre-crime division of the Washington D.C police department. The division's ability to stop murders before they happen is based on the psychic ability of three people who were mutant byproducts of a failed genetic program designed to help babies born from drug-dependent mothers. Cruise's character, John Anderton, is motivated by the loss of his own son, who was abducted and murdered six years earlier. Accordingly, he's a strong supporter of the controversial program, whose opponents feel it could potentially make an error and people might be wrongfully convicted, if not potentially rehabilitated. That action begins when Anderton is identified as a future killer, and he hits the road running. This may sound a little like The Fugitive, but in this case, you don't know if the man on the run is--or, rather, will be--guilty.

Based on a short story by futurist Phillip K. Dick, author of Blade Runner, the atmosphere of a dark world with high technology having gotten out of hand, almost as though it snuck up on us without our knowing, remains the theme. To remind us that we aren't controlled by technology, but are nonetheless overrun by it, there are frequent references to current-day familiarities, such as department stores and restaurants, such as The Gap and McDonalds, where impressively entertaining high-tech mass marketing gadgets know what you've purchased before and offer new suggestions for consideration. (Sounds like a visit to amazon.com?) Spielberg lightens up the tone with his signature wit and humorous quips and visuals now and then, as opposed to Ridley Scott's more serious and consistently dark visualization portrayed in Blade Runner.

As a plotline, Minority Report is intelligent, has a good consistent flow, isn't always predictable (at least not that long before it happens), has many twists and turns with legitimate dead-ends, and above all, tells a plausible story (even if the basic premise itself requires considerable suspension of disbelief). As Anderton begins to unravel the true story about the corruption behind the pre-crime program, he is lead even further towards his destination as predicted by the `pre-cognitives' who predicted his crime. To tell any more of the story would disclose too much; besides, it isn't necessary. You know all you need to know here.

The best parts of the movie are so good  from the high-tech special effects to the light-hearted humorous moments to the good, steady flow of the action and plotline  that the problems with the film are easily forgiven. That said, my main gripe is the presumption that, in the future, anyone convicted of a crime before it happens is immediately sent to a state of suspended animation, an alternative form of the death penalty. This is obviously one of the main sources of controversy within the storyline, but anyone can see that, in almost all cases, the predicted murders were not premeditated, if not potentially accidental, in which case, psychological counseling and some form of probation would be enough. There's nothing to suggest in the film that the context is a police state, which would allow the premise to make sense. Yet, so much of the movie is based on this premise, that may be bothersome to the discerning viewer. There are many such similar oversimplifications, each of which could be quite easily solved with a minor change or a quick dialog line or two, hence a mild sense of sloppiness in direction.

Still, in the end, these didn't bother me that much. I still had a great time, and enjoyed it as the frivolous and wonderfully playful action/thriller it was intended to be.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":529331,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2002-09-18","keywords":"year 2054,future noir,neo noir,washington d.c.,psychic","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Minority Report","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3333161241","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFhMjlhYTItMzViYi00ODFiLTlhNTAtYzQyYzM5ZmM4MDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFhMjlhYTItMzViYi00ODFiLTlhNTAtYzQyYzM5ZmM4MDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268199/","name":"Colin Farrell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0608090/","name":"Samantha Morton"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000229/","name":"Steven Spielberg"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001140/","name":"Philip K. programme.title: Breaking Them Up
Trzeba ich rozwieść
Breaking Them Up
programme.desc: Breaking Them Up: Directed by Scott Dow. With Stephen Schneider, Kelen Coleman, Jakob Wedel, Tess Aubert. When resourceful 15 year-old Damien decides that his parents are all wrong for each other, he enlists best friend Erin to help him set them up with other people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10832072/","name":"Breaking Them Up","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjk2ZGRkM2MtZjhiNC00MTY5LTg5MzItODFkMGUxMjM4MWUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMDAwOTE5._V1_.jpg","description":"When resourceful 15 year-old Damien decides that his parents are all wrong for each other, he enlists best friend Erin to help him set them up with other people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10832072/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kg-71703"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Award winning!","reviewBody":"Pressing play, I wasn't really expecting much from Breaking Them Up. Family movie about a teenage boy whose parents fight so much he's had enough. At school, he and his adoptable friend are talented love matchmakers. These two are presented with challenges, see opportunity and act upon it. .. Much to the benefit of their friends. But when the boy stages the plan to separate his parents, wanting to make his own life better, she is conflicted. And that's the core of the movie. What I was absolutely not expecting, yet amazingly surprised and gripped by, was the depth of feelings and connections expressed between each and all of these characters. The writing was fluid. Conversations were easy, natural, and enjoyable even when their content was difficult. Each scene had a purpose and I was always curious what would happen next? Watching our scope of freedom building, I was afraid of where I thought this might lead. I feel these choices could've been inspired by somebody's real life choices. In the end, satisfied and smiling, I feel I have a better understanding of other people's relationships, desires, and motivations. Few other shows have moved me like Breaking Them Up moved me.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":174,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2021-11-11","keywords":"friend","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Breaking Them Up","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3283075865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNlNWY3MzMtNTBiOC00MzA5LWJkMzMtMTlhNmUwNjQyODY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNlNWY3MzMtNTBiOC00MzA5LWJkMzMtMTlhNmUwNjQyODY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1447142/","name":"Stephen Schneider"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2584298/","name":"Kelen Coleman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5059328/","name":"Jakob Wedel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3438843/","name":"Scott Dow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3528615/","name":"Dev Wadhwa"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Right One
Ten jedyny
The Right One
programme.desc: The Right One: Directed by Ken Mok. With Cleopatra Coleman, Iliza Shlesinger, Leanne Lapp, David Koechner. Sara, a novelist struggling with writer's block, needs inspiration - and finds it when she meets Godfrey, a down-on-his-luck oddball who constantly changes personas and alter egos in order to cope with his past and avoid reality. Just as Godfrey begins to open up to Sara, he discovers that she's been using him as inspiration for her next novel, and he vanishes from her life. Did Sara just lose the man of her dreams, or will she be able to find him and make things right?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6820128/","name":"The Right One","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGI0ZGJlNzAtNDMxNi00N2E4LWEyNGMtNDA0OWE5MWQ4ZDhlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjA3MzE2ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sara, a novelist struggling with writer's block, needs inspiration - and finds it when she meets Godfrey, a down-on-his-luck oddball who constantly changes personas and alter egos in order to cope with his past and avoid reality. programme.title: The Witches
Wiedźmy
The Witches
programme.desc:
The Witches: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Chris Rock, Jahzir Bruno, Octavia Spencer, Brian Bovell. A young boy and his grandmother have a run-in with a coven of witches and their leader." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0805647/","name":"The Witches","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjRkYjlhMjEtYzIwOC00ZWYzLTgyMmQtYjI5M2UzNDJkNTU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young boy and his grandmother have a run-in with a coven of witches and their leader.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0805647/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sleepin_Dragon"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Please make these awful remakes stop.","reviewBody":"Oh Dear,

This should have been good, it needed to be good, sadly it just isn't. It's one of those films where a remake didn't seem to be necessary, but as someone that loved Roald Dahl as a child my interest was peaked.

It's inconsistent throughout, did they perhaps rush it because of Covid? The special effects look decent in parts, and woeful in others, Anne Hathaway displays personality it's fair to say, but her accent..... If anyone remembers Rentaghost, think Miss Popov, she spans countries from Ireland to Russia, it had me chuckling.

Once again, please, please try and give us something new and original, stop taking things that have already been made, and making them ten times worse. An extra point for casting the wonderful Josette Simon.

It made me want to watch Anjelica Huston.

I paid to download it, that money could have gone on something less awful, like a Donny Osmond cd.

Naff, 3/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34413,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2020-10-22","keywords":"based on novel,witch,european literature on screen,taking off shoes,barefoot female","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1302249753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjcxZmI2NzQtYjMxZi00YWE0LWI2M2YtOTBkY2FmNThhYTNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjcxZmI2NzQtYjMxZi00YWE0LWI2M2YtOTBkY2FmNThhYTNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In late 1967, a young orphaned boy (Bruno) goes to live with his Grandma (Spencer) in the rural Alabama town of Demopolis. As the boy and his grandmother encounter some deceptively glamorous but thoroughly diabolical witches, she wisely whisks our young hero away to an opulent seaside resort. Regrettably, they arrive at precisely the same time that the world's Grand High Witch (Hathaway) has gathered her fellow cronies from around the globe to carry out her nefarious plans."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0818055/","name":"Octavia Spencer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001804/","name":"Stanley Tucci"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038131/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016350/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1244069/","name":"Kenya Barris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

A young boy and his grandmother have a run-in with a coven of witches and their leader." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0805647/","name":"The Witches","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjRkYjlhMjEtYzIwOC00ZWYzLTgyMmQtYjI5M2UzNDJkNTU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young boy and his grandmother have a run-in with a coven of witches and their leader.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0805647/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Sleepin_Dragon","dateCreated":"2020-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Please make these awful remakes stop.","reviewBody":"Oh Dear,

This should have been good, it needed to be good, sadly it just isn't. It's one of those films where a remake didn't seem to be necessary, but as someone that loved Roald Dahl as a child my interest was peaked.

It's inconsistent throughout, did they perhaps rush it because of Covid? The special effects look decent in parts, and woeful in others, Anne Hathaway displays personality it's fair to say, but her accent..... If anyone remembers Rentaghost, think Miss Popov, she spans countries from Ireland to Russia, it had me chuckling.

Once again, please, please try and give us something new and original, stop taking things that have already been made, and making them ten times worse. An extra point for casting the wonderful Josette Simon.

It made me want to watch Anjelica Huston.

I paid to download it, that money could have gone on something less awful, like a Donny Osmond cd.

Naff, 3/10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34413,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2020-10-22","keywords":"based on novel,witch,european literature on screen,taking off shoes,barefoot female","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1302249753","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjcxZmI2NzQtYjMxZi00YWE0LWI2M2YtOTBkY2FmNThhYTNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjcxZmI2NzQtYjMxZi00YWE0LWI2M2YtOTBkY2FmNThhYTNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In late 1967, a young orphaned boy (Bruno) goes to live with his Grandma (Spencer) in the rural Alabama town of Demopolis. Whitaker is outstanding in this movie imo. His natural performance and presence gives life and authenticity to the character of journalist Jack Jackson. Johnny Depp is a surprise. Playing the aging retired police officer Russell Poole, his performance is well balanced, reduced and dedicated to capture the truth of Poole´s ambition and motivation. Whitaker and Depp harmonize, and it shows in the dialogues between Jackson and Poole. Two outstanding actors in an ambitioned movie about a timeless subject: finding truth in a swamp of lies.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11178,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-03-19","keywords":"reference to m.c. hammer,baseball game,singing in a police station,reference to robert f. kennedy,las vegas nevada","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"City of Lies","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3577200665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGZmZDc2NWUtZDJkNC00MmM3LTg4YzMtM2E5MjdlZGMzOGRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGZmZDc2NWUtZDJkNC00MmM3LTg4YzMtM2E5MjdlZGMzOGRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000136/","name":"Johnny Depp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001845/","name":"Forest Whitaker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0403947/","name":"Toby Huss"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1026778/","name":"Brad Furman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174578/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174578/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0838300/","name":"Randall Sullivan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2757852/","name":"Christian Contreras"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: True Grit
Prawdziwe męstwo
True Grit
programme.desc: True Grit: Directed by Ethan Coen, Joel Coen. With Jeff Bridges, Hailee Steinfeld, Matt Damon, Josh Brolin. A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1403865/","name":"True Grit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhkZDIzNjgtOTA5ZS00MmMzLWFkNjYtM2Y2MzFjN2FkNjAzL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1403865/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gobe-2"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"10/10 from a guy that does not like western movies","reviewBody":"To be honest I was never a big fan of western movies... Somehow I made myself to watch True Grit - had big doubts about it, but after all it was Coen brothers movie and it got only positive reviews all over internet. When the movie had finished I was completely stunned by how the story got me into it, how interesting and absorbing it was from the very first minutes!!! The characters were so genuine and extraordinary in the same time. I guess each of them could have their own individual movie, but here we had 3 of them crossing their paths of faith. Acting was just PERFECT - honestly I think this is Bridges best role, not to mention fantastic Damon and brilliant Steinfeld! In addition to that scenography and photography was excellent. Everything gave the viewer almost 2 hours of an amazing story, told in the best possible manner. Thank you brothers Coen for this masterpiece!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":325498,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Western"],"datePublished":"2011-02-23","keywords":"revisionist western,reference to new mexico,death by hanging,long drop hanging,spanking threat","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"True Grit: "Click" TV Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1984862489","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5NDM1NTAxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI1NTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5NDM1NTAxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI1NTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"True Grit: "Click" TV Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000313/","name":"Jeff Bridges"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2794962/","name":"Hailee Steinfeld"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152219/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093765/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0692427/","name":"Charles Portis"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1403865/","name":"True Grit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhkZDIzNjgtOTA5ZS00MmMzLWFkNjYtM2Y2MzFjN2FkNjAzL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1403865/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"gobe-2","dateCreated":"2011-10-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"10/10 from a guy that does not like western movies","reviewBody":"To be honest I was never a big fan of western movies... Somehow I made myself to watch True Grit - had big doubts about it, but after all it was Coen brothers movie and it got only positive reviews all over internet. When the movie had finished I was completely stunned by how the story got me into it, how interesting and absorbing it was from the very first minutes!!! The characters were so genuine and extraordinary in the same time. I guess each of them could have their own individual movie, but here we had 3 of them crossing their paths of faith. Acting was just PERFECT - honestly I think this is Bridges best role, not to mention fantastic Damon and brilliant Steinfeld! In addition to that scenography and photography was excellent. Everything gave the viewer almost 2 hours of an amazing story, told in the best possible manner. Thank you brothers Coen for this masterpiece!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":325498,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Western"],"datePublished":"2011-02-23","keywords":"revisionist western,reference to new mexico,death by hanging,long drop hanging,spanking threat","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"True Grit: "Click" TV Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1984862489","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5NDM1NTAxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI1NTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5NDM1NTAxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI1NTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"True Grit: "Click" TV Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000313/","name":"Jeff Bridges","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2794962/","name":"Hailee Steinfeld"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152219/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093765/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0692427/","name":"Charles Portis"],"duration":"PT1H50M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Ethan Coen, Joel Coen
